intro: Borreria tenella var. linoides, commonly known as the threadleaf borreria, is a flowering plant native to arid and semi-arid regions of the southwestern United States and northern Mexico. It is a member of the Rubiaceae family, which includes over 13,000 species of flowering plants. The plant is characterized by its small, narrow leaves and clusters of small, white to pale yellow flowers. It thrives in well-drained soils and is drought-tolerant, making it suitable for xeriscaping. Borreria tenella var. linoides is often used in ornamental gardening for its attractive foliage and low maintenance requirements.
